news_header: Police in South Africa are pursuing suspects in the murder of Muhsin Hendricks, the first openly gay imam. Hendricks was shot dead in Gqeberha, and his death has shocked the LGBTQ+ community.
news_original_title: South Africa police 'hot on heels' of suspects in gay imam killing
news_text: While an investigation is ongoing, it is unclear if the killing was a hate crime. Hendricks was known for advocating for marginalized Muslims and challenged traditional Islamic views on same-sex relationships. His work included founding organizations for queer Muslims and promoting interfaith dialogue. Despite South Africa's progressive laws on LGBTQ+ rights, discrimination and violence persist.
